text: Platte County is a county in the U.S. state of Wyoming. As of the 2020 census, 8,605 people lived there. Its county seat is Wheatland. == History == Platte County was created on February 21, 1911. The county was named for the North Platte River, which flows through the northeastern part of the county. == Geography == According to the US Census Bureau, the county has a total area of , of which is land and (1.3%) is water. It is the third-smallest county in Wyoming by area. === Bordering counties === * Niobrara County (northeast) * Goshen County (east) * Laramie County (south) * Albany County (west) * Converse County (northwest) == Communities == === Towns === * Chugwater * Glendo * Guernsey * Hartville * Wheatland (county seat) === Census-designated places === * Chugcreek * Lakeview North * Slater * Westview Circle * Y-O Ranch * Whiting === Unincorporated communities === * Bordeaux * Diamond * Dwyer * Dwyer Junction * Uva * Wendover === Ghost towns === * Sunrise == References == == Other websites == * Platte County, Wyoming official website Category:1911 establishments in Wyoming Category:Wyoming counties
title: Platte County, Wyoming
